books.title: Can We be Strangers Again?
books.author: Shrijeet Shandilya
books.description: Can We Be Strangers Again?" by Shrijeet Shandilya is a novel exploring the complexities of modern relationships, particularly after a significant breakup. It delves into the emotional turmoil of navigating the end of a meaningful relationship, the process of untangling lives, and the possibility of starting anew. The story focuses on the delicate balance between holding on and letting go, and the journey of self-discovery that follows heartache. It's a story about lost love, personal growth, and the search for self after a relationship ends
reviews: Dammmnn this book!! Really if you're having prblm in your friendship then definitely read this book. This book have given me the solution to my never ending thoughts. Definitely one of the best book it felt oddly relatable to meü•∫. Well end wasn't expected i wanted it to extend a little more like as they had mentioned about reunion party so I wanted it to be covered and then to sort things out but nothing like tht happened. But somewhere in a way it is good too. It gives a reality check and reality vibe tht not always there is a happy ending life isn't like tht we need to live with the sorrows and scars of the past still diving into future. HahhüòÆ‚Äçüí®. Well reading this book was worth it. 1stly I felt it boring but thanks to me and my patience that I stick to it. I wonder if this is the real story of author or someone.. well wish u luck if you're going to read it definitely worth it. Good day ‚ú®

books.title: One Day In December
books.author: Joise Silver
books.description: "One Day in December" by Josie Silver is a novel that follows Laurie, who experiences love at first sight with a man she sees through a bus window on a snowy December day. Over the next year, she searches for him, only to discover he's her best friend Sarah's new boyfriend, Jack. The story then spans a decade, exploring their complex relationships, missed opportunities, and the enduring nature of friendship.
reviews: I think this book is a little underrated.

This book has a totally Christmassy feeling. The story is basically Laurie met a guy on the way home before Christmas, she took a bus, and she was complaining about how unreasonable public transport is. But life is not that bad so she kind of gets a filmy moment when she sees a guy perched on the fold-down seats in the bus shelter with a book, like the world has been stopped around him and felt like love at first sight. They had eye contact and then the bus started going again. She is searching for that guy, she doesn't know his name or where he lives or anything.

She has a best friend, Sarah, she is her flatmate also and you know how best friends work they support you every time you are being unreasonable. Sarah is smart, and beautiful and loves Laurie so much they are kind of sisters from another mother. Sarah found a guy and fell in love with him, she thinks he is the one and she wants Laurie to meet him because she needs her best friend's opinion, that guy is the guy Laurie is searching for ages, but she can't say anything because her best friend finally found a guy. So finally she met Jake, he is everything she expected. What she did after that was the story.

This story is like you are watching a film on Christmas. You'll surely enjoy it. There are a few parts that were toxic, when Laurie got married to a guy she met on vacation. Marriage wasn't toxic but when you get married to someone but there is a part of you that knows you are still in love with someone else, that is toxic but that makes this story more dramatic though. I'm not telling you that you need to be toxic when you are in love don't get me wrong, I'm talking about the story only.

To be very honest the last part was kind of overdramatic that I love. When you are in so much love you can be a little filmy and overdramatic. The feeling of finally confessing to the person you are in love with that he loves you back is not a joke. Overall this is a very dramatic cute love story.
I read this in 2021 and still remember most of the part.

books.title: Lovers By The Sea
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: "Lovers by the Sea" likely refers to the short story "Lovers of the Sea" by WordPress.com, where a young woman, forbidden from the sea, finds solace in playing the piano while watching the waves. One day, she encounters a mysterious young man on the rocks and their connection is established through a shared love of the sea.

books.title: I Am Not Jessica
books.author: Ann Liang
books.description: "I Am Not Jessica Chen" by Ann Liang tells the story of Jenna Chen, a girl constantly living in the shadow of her academically gifted and popular cousin, Jessica. After failing to meet her parents' expectations, Jenna makes a wish to be Jessica, which is granted, and she wakes up in Jessica's body. Jenna soon discovers that Jessica's life, despite its outward perfection, is riddled with pressure and a lack of genuine connection, while simultaneously, everyone around her forgets who Jenna is. The novel explores themes of self-discovery, the pressures of academic achievement, and the importance of self-acceptance.

books.title: Dark Matter
books.author: Blake Crouch
books.description: "Dark Matter," by Blake Crouch, is a science fiction thriller about Jason Dessen, a physics professor kidnapped and thrust into a parallel universe where his life took a drastically different turn. In this alternate reality, he's a celebrated quantum physicist, but estranged from his family, a stark contrast to his life as a devoted family man with a wife and son. Driven by the desire to return to his original reality, Jason embarks on a mind-bending journey through the multiverse, confronting versions of himself and questioning the nature of choice, identity, and reality itself.

books.title: DARK
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: A murderous, undead girl haunts the remote stretch of woods where she was killed decades earlier. One night, she discovers a blind boy hiding in the trunk of one of her victim's cars. Her decision to let the boy live throws her solitary existence into upheaval, and ultimately forces her to re-examine just how much of her humanity her murderer was able to destroy.

books.title: Half Girlfriend
books.author: Chetan Bhagat
books.description: French novel by Balzac, depicting Parisian society.

books.title: 400 days
books.author: Chetan Bhagat
books.description: French novel by Balzac, depicting Parisian society.

books.title: REVOLUTION TWENTY 20
books.author: Chetan Bhagat
books.description: French novel by Balzac, depicting Parisian society.

books.title: Red Flags And Rishtas
books.author: Radhika Agrawal
books.description: French novel by Balzac, depicting Parisian society.

books.title: Five Point Someone
books.author: Chetan Bhagat
books.description: French novel by Balzac, depicting Parisian society.

books.title: Weird But Normal
books.author: Mia Mercado
books.description: French novel by Balzac, depicting Parisian society.

books.title: Anxiety Happens
books.author: Chetan Bhagat
books.description: French novel by Balzac, depicting Parisian society.

books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: "1899" is a mystery-horror series set in 1899, following a group of European immigrants traveling to America on the steamship Kerberos. Their journey takes a dark turn when they encounter the derelict ship Prometheus, lost for months, and find it deserted. The discovery unravels a complex web of secrets connecting the passengers' pasts, turning their voyage into a nightmarish riddle. The series creators, known for "Dark", explore themes of identity, language, and the human condition against a backdrop of supernatural occurrences.

books.title: The Tank
books.author: G.R. Taylor
books.description: "The Tank," a novel by G.R. Taylor, tells the story of Benjamin Kane, a man with a violent past who is imprisoned for his vigilantism. Inside Two Rocks Supermax, he finds himself surrounded by the very criminals he used to hunt, but his mission is far from over; he sees his imprisonment as an opportunity to further punish predators.

books.title: A Lab Rat's Guide To Fated Love
books.author: Nori Arya
books.description: "A Lab Rat's Guide to Fated Love" follows Vir, a man inexplicably drawn to Dr. Nori Arya, a nano-biotechnology scientist, due to her uncanny resemblance to a woman in his dreams. As their paths intertwine in a scientific program, Vir's sanity is questioned, especially when he senses a darkness within Nori. Nori, in turn, finds her carefully constructed facade crumbling as she navigates her first human subject and the sabotage attempts from rivals. Their connection deepens, leading to a romantic entanglement in a secluded cottage, where they must confront the consequences of their growing feelings and the potential cost of holding onto each other.

books.title: 100 Days of Sun Light
books.author: Abbie Emmons
books.description: "100 Days of Sunlight" by Abbie Emmons tells the story of Tessa Dickinson, a 16-year-old poetry blogger, who loses her sight after a car accident. Devastated and scared, she withdraws from the world. Her grandparents hire a typist to help her continue writing, and Weston Ludovico, a boy who has lost his legs, applies. Tessa initially rejects Weston's optimistic outlook, but as they grow closer, he helps her find a new perspective on life despite her blindness. The story explores themes of disability, self-acceptance, and the power of human connection.

books.title: Happy Place
books.author: Emily Henry
books.description: "Happy Place" by Emily Henry follows Harriet and Wyn, a couple who have secretly broken up but continue to pretend they're still together during their annual friend getaway to their beloved Maine cottage. Their friends are unaware of the split, and one couple is even planning a wedding at the cottage, making it crucial for Harriet and Wyn to maintain the charade for one last week. The novel explores their past relationship, their present struggles, and their complicated feelings as they navigate this final trip together, confronting their unresolved issues and rediscovering what truly makes them happy.

books.title: Once upon a Curfew
books.author: Srishti Chaudhary
books.description: "Once Upon a Curfew" by Srishti Chaudhary is a historical fiction novel set in 1970s Delhi, during India's Emergency period. The story revolves around Indira (Indu), a young woman who inherits a flat and dreams of turning it into a library for women. As she works towards her goal, she finds herself drawn to a young lawyer, Rana, while her fianc√©, Rajat, is away in London. The declaration of the Emergency throws their lives into disarray, forcing Indu to confront her choices and decide what kind of life she truly wants.

books.title: The Lost Book Shop
books.author: Evie Woods
books.description: The Lost Bookshop, by Evie Woods, tells the story of three individuals whose lives become intertwined through a mysterious, vanishing bookshop in Dublin. Opaline, a woman escaping an arranged marriage in the 1920s, finds herself in Paris working at Shakespeare and Company, learning about rare books and encountering literary figures. In the present day, Martha, fleeing an abusive marriage, becomes a housekeeper, and Henry, a scholar, searches for a lost Emily Bront√´ manuscript and a mysterious bookshop. Their paths converge when Henry discovers a letter hinting at the bookshop's existence and enlists Martha's help in his search, leading them to Madame Bowden's house, which seems to be the location of the lost bookshop. The story explores themes of escape, resilience, and the power of literature, with a touch of magical realism as the characters navigate their own extraordinary stories within the bookshop's walls.

books.title: The Girl Who Drank the Moon
books.author: witch Xan
books.description: "The Girl Who Drank the Moon" tells the story of Luna, a child accidentally "enmagicked" with moonlight by the witch Xan, who raises her alongside a swamp monster and a tiny dragon. Meanwhile, in the Protectorate, a young man named Antain begins to question the tradition of sacrificing infants to the witch, leading him on a journey to uncover the truth about the witch and the town's practices. The novel explores themes of love, sacrifice, courage, and the nature of good and evil as Luna's magic emerges and threatens to disrupt the fragile peace.

books.title: We Dream of Space
books.author: Erin Entrada
books.description: "We Dream of Space" by Erin Entrada Kelly follows three siblings, Cash, Fitch, and Bird Nelson Thomas, in the weeks leading up to the 1986 Challenger space shuttle launch. Each sibling grapples with personal challenges and anxieties, while also navigating the tense and often chaotic atmosphere of their home life. The book explores themes of family dysfunction, the impact of tragedy, and the power of connection and hope, especially within the context of the Challenger disaster.

books.title: The Voice in my Head
books.author: Dana L.Davis
books.description: "The Voice in My Head" by Dana L. Davis tells the story of identical twins Indigo and Violet, where Violet is terminally ill and planning a medically assisted death. Indigo, struggling with this, attempts suicide and then hears a voice she believes to be God. This voice urges them to embark on a road trip to Arizona's Wave rock formation, promising Violet's healing if they reach it. The family, including their controlling older sister, distant parents, and other relatives, reluctantly join the journey in a paratransit bus. The trip becomes a chaotic and emotional experience as they confront their individual and family dysfunctions, forcing Indigo to step up and lead, while also dealing with her own insecurities and the voice in her head.

books.title: Things Fall Apart
books.author: Chinua Achebe
books.description: Classic Nigerian novel exploring tradition and change in Igbo society.

books.title: Fairy tales
books.author: Hans Christian Andersen
books.description: Collection of fairy tales by Hans Christian Andersen.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.description: Dante Alighieri's The Divine Comedy, written between 1308 and 1321, is a cornerstone of Italian and world literature. This epic poem chronicles Dante's allegorical journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven, reflecting the medieval Christian worldview and exploring universal themes of sin, redemption, justice, and love.
reviews: Critical perspectives and lasting influence of The Divine Comedy.
Dante Alighieri's The Divine Comedy has garnered praise for its literary artistry, theological depth, and insightful exploration of the human condition and the quest for meaning across centuries.

books.title: One Indian Woman
books.author: Chetan Bhagat
books.description: Ancient Mesopotamian poem regarded as one of the earliest works of literature.

books.title: The Blue Umbrella
books.author: Ruskin Bond
books.description: A book from the Hebrew Bible that explores human suffering and faith.

books.title: Tokyo ever after
books.author: Emiko Jean
books.description: A collection of Middle Eastern folk tales compiled in Arabic during the Islamic Golden Age.

books.title: Annie's life in lists
books.author: Kristin Mahoney
books.description: Icelandic saga describing events from the 10th and 11th centuries.

books.title: The Book of Moods
books.author: Lauren Martin
books.description: Jane Austen's classic novel about love and social standing.

books.title: One Arranged Murder
books.author: Chetan Bhagat
books.description: French novel by Balzac, depicting Parisian society.

books.title: Better Than Movies
books.author: Lynn Painter
books.description: Trilogy of novels by Samuel Beckett exploring existential themes.
